#text=After a long and dreary winter , most of us are ready to see green plants , blooming flowers , and a clean cut green lawn in our yards .
#text=Springtime is also an opportunity to freshen up our yards with new plants .
#text=Taking this into consideration , I decided to make a trip to my local lawn and garden shop .
#text=As expected the shop had tons of blooming pot flowers .
#text=I could n't help but pick at least one .
#text=I was tempted to even buy a fruit plant , but decided to save my money and buy that another time .
#text=What particularly took my interest was a young oak sapling that was hiding in the back behind all the potted flowers .
#text=I did n't have any oak trees in my yard , and to be honest neither did anyone in my neighborhood .
#text=I thought it would be a fantastic idea to introduce this tree to my front yard .
#text=So I paid the $ 15 for the young sapling and prepared to plant it next to my driveway .
#text=To begin , I found a small shovel from my garage and dug out a 1 foot diameter and 1 foot deep circular hole .
#text=I picked out any rocks that were remaining in the hole , removed any surrounding weeds .
#text=Then I removed the tree from its temporary pot and put it and the nutrient-filled soil it came in into the hole I dug out .
#text=Then filled the rest of the hole with dirt , gave the plant a little water , and waited for it to grow into a big healthy tree .
